messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: encouraging a child to stick with it--REALLY LONG!
messages.msgSnippet: ... wishing ... the ... Next ... Funny, I hardly ever sew anymore, but I used to do something like that with sewing.  Once I made the third mistake that
messages.messageBody:
> Sometimes when I'm feeling hyper, maybe doing a lot of housework and
wishing
> I weren't, sometimes I put music at the keyboard, and sit and play until
the
> third mistake, which I consider "losing," and then I go work some more.
Next
> time I sit, I only play until the third error, etc.

Funny, I hardly ever sew anymore, but I used to do something like that with
sewing. Once I made the third mistake that involved ripping something out,
I knew I was done for the day. Any more sewing would mean way more
mistakes.
Tia
